content: 1 sunbeams granny square pa$ern by karen tate @crochetdahlia published 9th april 2023 materials yarn scheepjes catona x 7 colours 7g/0 25oz in total hook 3 0mm scissors yarn needle 4 sktch markers finished measurements 10cm/4 using recommended yarn gauge is not important experience level advanced beginner abbrevia@ons us terms slip_stitch slip_stitch chain chain single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet fpdc front post double_crochet stdc standing double_crochet st stitch treble_crochet treble_crochet sttr standing treble_crochet yo yarn over chsp chain space half_double_crochet half_double_crochet stsc standing single_crochet 2 general notes & special stitches stdc - attach slip knot to hook yo insert hook into st/chsp yo pull up a loop 3 loops on hook yo pull through 2 loops 2 loops on hook yo pull through 2 loops fpdc - yo insert hook front to back around the post of the double_crochet instead of into the st bring hook to front yo bring up to the level of the double_crochet complete double_crochet as usual sttr attach slip knot to hook yo 2 times insert hook into st/chsp yo pull up a loop 4 loops on hook yo pull through 2 loops 3 times stsc - attach slip knot to hook insert hook into st/chsp yo pull up a loop 2 loops on hook yo pull through 2 loops invisible join - cut yarn leaving about 10cm/4 and pull through the top of the last stitch made thread your yarn needle with this tail insert the yarn needle under both loops of the second stitch of the round then insert the yarn needle through the centre of the last stitch made and pull gently until your new loop matches the rest fasten_off *_* - repeat whole round - - total number of stitches at the end of the round start each round with a standing stitch which i recommend or a chain ch1=single_crochet ch3=double_crochet ch4=treble_crochet end each round with an invisible join which i recommend or a slip_stitch to the first stitch blocking your granny squares ensures every square will be the same size and your finished piece will have a more polished look pa$ern instruc@ons r1 r2 r3 r4 3 r1 colour a magic_ring ch3 counts as a double_crochet 9dc in the ring join with a slip_stitch to the 3rd chain of the beginning ch3 fasten_off 10dc r2 colour b stdc in any double_crochet st from r1 fpdc around post of same st *double_crochet into next st fpdc around same st* x 9 slip_stitch to the beginning stdc or make an invisible join fasten_off 10dc 10fpdc r3 colour c stdc in any double_crochet st from r2 double_crochet into same st fpdc around fpdc from r2 *2dc into next st fpdc around fpdc from r2* x 9 slip_stitch to the beginning stdc or make an invisible join fasten_off 20dc 10fpdc r4 colour d stdc in any double_crochet aper a fpdc from r3 double_crochet into same st double_crochet into next st fpdc around fpdc from r3 *2dc into next st double_crochet fpdc around fpdc from r3*
